Package org.xjge.graphics

Class PostProcessShader

java.lang.Object
org.xjge.graphics.PostProcessShader
public abstract class PostProcessShader
extends java.lang.Object
These objects are used to apply post-processing effects to the framebuffer texture of a viewport. They achieve this by changing which shader program the framebuffer object will use during its rendering cycle.

NOTE: When defining shaders for post processing effects take care to make sure that the vertex layout is organized correctly (this consists of a vec3 at location 0, and a vec2 at location 2). It's also worth mentioning that framebuffers write to texture objects so any shader program that wishes to apply post-processing effects should contain (at minimum) the following code; 

 //Vertex Shader
 #version 330 core
 
 layout (location = 0) in vec3 aPosition;
 layout (location = 2) in vec2 aTexCoords;
 
 uniform mat4 uProjection;
 
 out vec2 ioTexCoords;
 
 void main() {
     ioTexCoords = aTexCoords;
     gl_Position = uProjection * vec4(aPosition, 1);
 }
 
 
 //Fragment Shader
 #version 330 core
 
 in vec2 ioTexCoords;
 
 uniform sampler2D uTexture;
 
 float sharpen(float pixArray) {
     float normal  = (fract(pixArray) - 0.5) * 2.0;
     float normal2 = normal * normal;
 
     return floor(pixArray) + normal * pow(normal2, 2.0) / 2.0 + 0.5;
 }
 
 void main() {
     vec2 vRes = textureSize(uTexture, 0);
 
     vec3 sceneColor = texture(uTexture, vec2(
         sharpen(ioTexCoords.x * vRes.x) / vRes.x,
           sharpen(ioTexCoords.y * vRes.y) / vRes.y
     )).rgb;
 
     sceneColor.r = 0;
     
     gl_FragColor = vec4(sceneColor, 1);
 }

  • Method Details

    • render

      public abstract void render​(int viewTexHandle, int bloomTexHandle, org.joml.Matrix4f projMatrix, Graphics g)
      Acts like any other render method does within the engine with the exception that it runs
      Parameters:
      viewTexHandle - the handle of the framebuffer texture containing color information
      bloomTexHandle - the handle of another framebuffer texture generated by the engine when bloom effects are enabled
      projMatrix - A temporary projection matrix used by the engine. You'll want to pass this to your custom post-process shader during the vertex stage.
      g - the graphics object used by the viewport
